verses.kjv: I am sought of them that asked not for me; I am found of them that sought me not: I said, Behold me, behold me, unto a nation that was not called by my name.
verses.web: “I am inquired of by those who didn’t ask. I am found by those who didn’t seek me. I said, ‘See me, see me,’ to a nation that was not called by my name.
verses.ct: "I made myself available to people who never asked for me. I let myself be found by people who weren't even looking for me. I called out, 'Here I am! Here I am!' to a nation that didn't bear my name.

verses.kjv: I have spread out my hands all the day unto a rebellious people, which walketh in a way that was not good, after their own thoughts;
verses.web: I have spread out my hands all day to a rebellious people, who walk in a way that is not good, after their own thoughts;
verses.ct: All day long I stretched out my hands to a rebellious people who walk down the wrong path, chasing their own ideas.

verses.kjv: A people that provoketh me to anger continually to my face; that sacrificeth in gardens, and burneth incense upon altars of brick;
verses.web: a people who provoke me to my face continually, sacrificing in gardens, and burning incense on bricks;
verses.ct: They are people who constantly provoke me right to my face — offering sacrifices in pagan gardens and burning incense on altars made of brick.

verses.kjv: Which remain among the graves, and lodge in the monuments, which eat swine’s flesh, and broth of abominable things is in their vessels;
verses.web: who sit among the graves, and spend nights in secret places; who eat pig’s meat, and broth of abominable things is in their vessels;
verses.ct: They sit among the graves and spend their nights in secret places. They eat pig's flesh, and their pots are full of broth made from disgusting things.

verses.kjv: Which say, Stand by thyself, come not near to me; for I am holier than thou. These are a smoke in my nose, a fire that burneth all the day.
verses.web: who say, ‘Stay by yourself, don’t come near to me, for I am holier than you.’ These are smoke in my nose, a fire that burns all day.
verses.ct: They tell others, 'Keep your distance — don't come near me, because I'm holier than you.' These people are like smoke in my nostrils, a fire that smolders all day long.

verses.kjv: Behold, it is written before me: I will not keep silence, but will recompense, even recompense into their bosom,
verses.web: “Behold, it is written before me: I will not keep silence, but will repay, yes, I will repay into their bosom,
verses.ct: "Look — it's all written down in front of me. I won't stay silent. I will pay them back in full.

verses.kjv: Your iniquities, and the iniquities of your fathers together, saith the LORD, which have burned incense upon the mountains, and blasphemed me upon the hills: therefore will I measure their former work into their bosom.
verses.web: your own iniquities, and the iniquities of your fathers together”, says LORD, “who have burned incense on the mountains, and blasphemed me on the hills. Therefore I will first measure their work into their bosom.”
verses.ct: I will repay them for their own sins and the sins of their ancestors together," says the LORD. "They burned incense on the mountains and insulted me on the hills. So I will measure out the full payment they've earned and pour it right back on them."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, As the new wine is found in the cluster, and one saith, Destroy it not; for a blessing is in it: so will I do for my servants’ sakes, that I may not destroy them all.
verses.web: LORD says, “As the new wine is found in the cluster, and one says, ‘Don’t destroy it, for a blessing is in it:’ so I will do for my servants’ sake, that I may not destroy them all.
verses.ct: The LORD says, "When new wine is found in a cluster of grapes, someone says, 'Don't destroy it — there's still something good in it.' That's what I'll do for the sake of my servants. I won't destroy them all.

verses.kjv: And I will bring forth a seed out of Jacob, and out of Judah an inheritor of my mountains: and mine elect shall inherit it, and my servants shall dwell there.
verses.web: I will bring offspring out of Jacob, and out of Judah an inheritor of my mountains. My chosen will inherit it, and my servants will dwell there.
verses.ct: I will bring descendants from Jacob and from Judah people who will inherit my mountains. My chosen ones will possess the land, and my servants will live there.

verses.kjv: And Sharon shall be a fold of flocks, and the valley of Achor a place for the herds to lie down in, for my people that have sought me.
verses.web: Sharon will be a fold of flocks, and the valley of Achor a place for herds to lie down in, for my people who have sought me.
verses.ct: Sharon will become pastureland for flocks, and the valley of Achor a resting place for herds — all for my people who have sought me.

verses.kjv: But ye are they that forsake the LORD, that forget my holy mountain, that prepare a table for that troop, and that furnish the drink offering unto that number.
verses.web: “But you who forsake LORD, who forget my holy mountain, who prepare a table for Fortune, and who fill up mixed wine to Destiny;
verses.ct: "But as for you who abandon the LORD, who forget my holy mountain, who set a table for the god Fortune and fill cups of mixed wine for the god Destiny —

verses.kjv: Therefore will I number you to the sword, and ye shall all bow down to the slaughter: because when I called, ye did not answer; when I spake, ye did not hear; but did evil before mine eyes, and did choose that wherein I delighted not.
verses.web: I will destine you to the sword, and you will all bow down to the slaughter; because when I called, you didn’t answer. When I spoke, you didn’t listen; but you did that which was evil in my eyes, and chose that in which I didn’t delight.”
verses.ct: I will destine you for the sword, and every one of you will bow down to be slaughtered. Because when I called, you didn't answer. When I spoke, you didn't listen. Instead, you did what the LORD saw as evil and chose what doesn't please me."

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD, Behold, my servants shall eat, but ye shall be hungry: behold, my servants shall drink, but ye shall be thirsty: behold, my servants shall rejoice, but ye shall be ashamed:
verses.web: Therefore the Lord LORD says, “Behold, my servants will eat, but you will be hungry; behold, my servants will drink, but you will be thirsty. Behold, my servants will rejoice, but you will be disappointed;
verses.ct: So the Lord GOD says this: "My servants will eat, but you will go hungry. My servants will drink, but you will go thirsty. My servants will celebrate, but you will be put to shame.

verses.kjv: Behold, my servants shall sing for joy of heart, but ye shall cry for sorrow of heart, and shall howl for vexation of spirit.
verses.web: Behold, my servants will sing for joy of heart, but you will cry for sorrow of heart, and will wail for anguish of spirit.
verses.ct: My servants will sing from hearts full of joy, but you will cry out from hearts full of pain and wail from a crushed spirit.

verses.kjv: And ye shall leave your name for a curse unto my chosen: for the Lord GOD shall slay thee, and call his servants by another name:
verses.web: You will leave your name for a curse to my chosen; and the Lord LORD will kill you. He will call his servants by another name,
verses.ct: Your name will become a curse word among my chosen ones, because the Lord GOD will put you to death. But he will give his servants a brand new name.

verses.kjv: That he who blesseth himself in the earth shall bless himself in the God of truth; and he that sweareth in the earth shall swear by the God of truth; because the former troubles are forgotten, and because they are hid from mine eyes.
verses.web: so that he who blesses himself in the earth will bless himself in the God of truth; and he who swears in the earth will swear by the God of truth; because the former troubles are forgotten, and because they are hidden from my eyes.
verses.ct: So whoever asks for a blessing on earth will ask it from the God of truth, and whoever makes an oath on earth will swear by the God of truth — because the old troubles will be forgotten, hidden completely from my eyes.

verses.kjv: For, behold, I create new heavens and a new earth: and the former shall not be remembered, nor come into mind.
verses.web: “For, behold, I create new heavens and a new earth; and the former things will not be remembered, nor come into mind.
verses.ct: "Pay attention — I am creating new heavens and a new earth! The old ways will not be remembered or even come to mind.

verses.kjv: But be ye glad and rejoice for ever in that which I create: for, behold, I create Jerusalem a rejoicing, and her people a joy.
verses.web: But be glad and rejoice forever in that which I create; for, behold, I create Jerusalem to be a delight, and her people a joy.
verses.ct: Instead, be glad and rejoice forever in what I'm creating! I am making Jerusalem a place of delight and her people a source of joy.

verses.kjv: And I will rejoice in Jerusalem, and joy in my people: and the voice of weeping shall be no more heard in her, nor the voice of crying.
verses.web: I will rejoice in Jerusalem, and delight in my people; and the voice of weeping and the voice of crying will be heard in her no more.
verses.ct: I myself will rejoice over Jerusalem and take delight in my people. The sound of weeping and crying will never be heard there again.

verses.kjv: There shall be no more thence an infant of days, nor an old man that hath not filled his days: for the child shall die an hundred years old; but the sinner being an hundred years old shall be accursed.
verses.web: “No more will there be an infant who only lives a few days, nor an old man who has not filled his days; for the child will die one hundred years old, and the sinner being one hundred years old will be accursed.
verses.ct: "Never again will an infant live only a few days, or an old person die before living a full life. Someone who dies at 100 will be considered just a child, and a sinner who only reaches 100 will be considered cursed.

verses.kjv: And they shall build houses, and inhabit them; and they shall plant vineyards, and eat the fruit of them.
verses.web: They will build houses and inhabit them. They will plant vineyards and eat their fruit.
verses.ct: People will build houses and actually live in them. They'll plant vineyards and actually eat their fruit.

verses.kjv: They shall not build, and another inhabit; they shall not plant, and another eat: for as the days of a tree are the days of my people, and mine elect shall long enjoy the work of their hands.
verses.web: They will not build and another inhabit. They will not plant and another eat: for the days of my people will be like the days of a tree, and my chosen will long enjoy the work of their hands.
verses.ct: They won't build a house only for someone else to live in it. They won't plant crops only for someone else to eat them. My people will live as long as trees, and my chosen ones will fully enjoy the work of their own hands.

verses.kjv: They shall not labour in vain, nor bring forth for trouble; for they are the seed of the blessed of the LORD, and their offspring with them.
verses.web: They will not labor in vain nor give birth for calamity; for they are the offspring of LORD’s blessed and their descendants with them.
verses.ct: They won't work for nothing or have children only to see them face disaster. They are the offspring of those the LORD has blessed, and their descendants along with them.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, that before they call, I will answer; and while they are yet speaking, I will hear.
verses.web: It will happen that before they call, I will answer; and while they are yet speaking, I will hear.
verses.ct: Before they even call out to me, I will answer. While they're still speaking, I will hear them.

verses.kjv: The wolf and the lamb shall feed together, and the lion shall eat straw like the bullock: and dust shall be the serpent’s meat. They shall not hurt nor destroy in all my holy mountain, saith the LORD.
verses.web: The wolf and the lamb will feed together. The lion will eat straw like the ox. Dust will be the serpent’s food. They will not hurt nor destroy in all my holy mountain,” says LORD.
verses.ct: The wolf and the lamb will graze side by side. The lion will eat straw like an ox, and dust will be the serpent's food. Nothing will cause harm or destruction anywhere on my holy mountain," says the LORD.
